meanings.def: under the surface of the ground
examples: an underground bunker/tunnel
underground parking
an underground car park
underground passages/caves/streams
underground cables
They carried out a series of underground nuclear tests.

meanings.def: operating secretly and often illegally, especially against a government
examples: an underground resistance movement
The changes will affect all workers, whether underground or legal.
The party was originally formed as an underground organization in 1987.

meanings.def: under the surface of the ground
examples: Rescuers found victims trapped several feet underground.
animals that live underground
toxic waste buried deep underground
a network of pipelines running underground

meanings.def: in or into a secret place in order to hide from the police, the government, etc.
examples: He went underground to avoid arrest.
If the group is outlawed they will go underground.
Opposition groups have been driven underground.

meanings.def: an underground railway system in a city
examples: underground stations
the London Underground
I always travel by underground.
I always seem to get lost in the underground.
I often travel on the underground.
It brought the whole underground system to a halt.

meanings.def: a secret political organization, usually working against the government of a country
a person who works against the government as a member of a secret political organization
